column4: can anyone please tell me how to force a i386 architecture program on a 64 bit machine without affecting other programs?
can anyone please tell me how to force a i386 architecture program on a 64 bit machine without affecting other programs?
just google "how install 32 bit applications ubuntu" or something
i think you're on to something
what are you tryign to install?
flash player
is there some reason you can't use the 64bit flash?
because its not working well, its alpha
I didn't realize that. I'm running x86_64 and i've never had a problem with it except there was no audio at first, but installing one extra package fixed that
now i have no video
did you download from here: http://labs.adobe.com/downloads/flashplayer10.html ?
yes i downloaded the same file from a different page
and you have no video when you try to view, say, a youtube video?
but you get audio?
thats right
ok hang on a sec
wow i find many results for no audio, but not many for no video...
but are there some?
do you have ubuntu-restricted-extras package installed?
yes
and do you know what video driver you are using?
msg/ martin_henry hi
look here to install latest nvidia driver http://ubuntuguide.org/wiki/Ubuntu:Jaunty#Graphics_Card
